references.paper_title: Learning a deep convolutional network for image super-resolution
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work in deep learning-based image super-resolution, establishing the use of convolutional neural networks for this task and influencing many subsequent approaches.

references.paper_title: Photo-realistic single image super-resolution using a generative adversarial network
references.reason: This paper introduced generative adversarial networks (GANs) to image super-resolution, significantly improving the visual quality of results and inspiring further research into GAN-based methods.

This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a powerful class of generative models that has revolutionized image generation and is now being extensively applied to image super-resolution.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper advanced diffusion models to achieve high-resolution image synthesis, significantly improving the quality and detail of generated images and providing the foundation for many text-to-image models and their applications to image super-resolution.

references.paper_title: Exploiting diffusion prior for real-world image super-resolution
references.reason: This paper is among the most recent and relevant to the current work, demonstrating the effectiveness of applying pre-trained diffusion models to real-world image super-resolution, specifically addressing challenges in handling complex real-world degradations.
